trans-unit.source: Get battery information
trans-unit.target: Get battery information

trans-unit.source: Learn how to get detailed battery information using APIs in the Windows.Devices.Power namespace.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to get detailed battery information using APIs in the Windows.Devices.Power namespace.

trans-unit.source: Get battery information
trans-unit.target: Get battery information

trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows.Devices.Power
trans-unit.target: Windows.Devices.Power

trans-unit.source: DeviceInformation.FindAllAsync
trans-unit.target: DeviceInformation.FindAllAsync

trans-unit.source: Learn how to get detailed battery information using APIs in the [**Windows.Devices.Power**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895017) namespace.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to get detailed battery information using APIs in the [**Windows.Devices.Power**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895017) namespace.

trans-unit.source: A *battery report* ([**BatteryReport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895005)) describes the charge, capacity, and status of a battery or aggregate of batteries.
trans-unit.target: A *battery report* ([**BatteryReport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895005)) describes the charge, capacity, and status of a battery or aggregate of batteries.

trans-unit.source: This topic demonstrates how your app can get battery reports and be notified of changes.
trans-unit.target: This topic demonstrates how your app can get battery reports and be notified of changes.

trans-unit.source: Code examples are from the basic battery app that's listed at the end of this topic.
trans-unit.target: Code examples are from the basic battery app that's listed at the end of this topic.

trans-unit.source: Get aggregate battery report
trans-unit.target: Get aggregate battery report

trans-unit.source: Some devices have more than one battery and it's not always obvious how each battery contributes to the overall energy capacity of the device.
trans-unit.target: Some devices have more than one battery and it's not always obvious how each battery contributes to the overall energy capacity of the device.

trans-unit.source: This is where the [**AggregateBattery**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895011) class comes in.
trans-unit.target: This is where the [**AggregateBattery**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895011) class comes in.

trans-unit.source: The *aggregate battery* represents all battery controllers connected to the device and can provide a single overall [**BatteryReport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895005) object.
trans-unit.target: The *aggregate battery* represents all battery controllers connected to the device and can provide a single overall [**BatteryReport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895005) object.

trans-unit.source: **Note** A [**Battery**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895004) class actually corresponds to a battery controller.
trans-unit.target: **Note** A [**Battery**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895004) class actually corresponds to a battery controller.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the device, sometimes the controller is attached to the physical battery and sometimes it's attached to the device enclosure.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the device, sometimes the controller is attached to the physical battery and sometimes it's attached to the device enclosure.

trans-unit.source: Thus, it's possible to create a battery object even when no batteries are present.
trans-unit.target: Thus, it's possible to create a battery object even when no batteries are present.

trans-unit.source: Other times, the battery object may be **null**.
trans-unit.target: Other times, the battery object may be **null**.

trans-unit.source: Once you have an aggregate battery object, call [**GetReport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.battery.getreport) to get the corresponding [**BatteryReport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895005).
trans-unit.target: Once you have an aggregate battery object, call [**GetReport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.battery.getreport) to get the corresponding [**BatteryReport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895005).

trans-unit.source: Get individual battery reports
trans-unit.target: Get individual battery reports

trans-unit.source: You can also create a [**BatteryReport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895005) object for individual batteries.
trans-unit.target: You can also create a [**BatteryReport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895005) object for individual batteries.

trans-unit.source: Use [**GetDeviceSelector**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.battery.getdeviceselector.aspx) with the [**FindAllAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225432) method to obtain a collection of [**DeviceInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225393) objects that represent any battery controllers that are connected to the device.
trans-unit.target: Use [**GetDeviceSelector**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.battery.getdeviceselector.aspx) with the [**FindAllAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225432) method to obtain a collection of [**DeviceInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225393) objects that represent any battery controllers that are connected to the device.

trans-unit.source: Then, using the **Id** property of the desired **DeviceInformation** object, create a corresponding [**Battery**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895004) with the [**FromIdAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.battery.fromidasync.aspx) method.
trans-unit.target: Then, using the **Id** property of the desired **DeviceInformation** object, create a corresponding [**Battery**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895004) with the [**FromIdAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.battery.fromidasync.aspx) method.

trans-unit.source: Finally, call [**GetReport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.battery.getreport) to get the individual battery report.
trans-unit.target: Finally, call [**GetReport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.battery.getreport) to get the individual battery report.

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to create a battery report for all batteries connected to the device.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to create a battery report for all batteries connected to the device.

trans-unit.source: Access report details
trans-unit.target: Access report details

trans-unit.source: The [**BatteryReport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895005) object provides a lot of battery information.
trans-unit.target: The [**BatteryReport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895005) object provides a lot of battery information.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see the API reference for its properties: **Status** (a [**BatteryStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn818458) enumeration), [**ChargeRateInMilliwatts**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.batteryreport.chargerateinmilliwatts.aspx), [**DesignCapacityInMilliwattHours**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.batteryreport.designcapacityinmilliwatthours.aspx), [**FullChargeCapacityInMilliwattHours**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.batteryreport.fullchargecapacityinmilliwatthours.aspx), and [**RemainingCapacityInMilliwattHours**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.batteryreport.remainingcapacityinmilliwatthours).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see the API reference for its properties: **Status** (a [**BatteryStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn818458) enumeration), [**ChargeRateInMilliwatts**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.batteryreport.chargerateinmilliwatts.aspx), [**DesignCapacityInMilliwattHours**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.batteryreport.designcapacityinmilliwatthours.aspx), [**FullChargeCapacityInMilliwattHours**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.batteryreport.fullchargecapacityinmilliwatthours.aspx), and [**RemainingCapacityInMilliwattHours**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.batteryreport.remainingcapacityinmilliwatthours).

trans-unit.source: This example shows some of the battery report properties used by the basic battery app, that's provided later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: This example shows some of the battery report properties used by the basic battery app, that's provided later in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Request report updates
trans-unit.target: Request report updates

trans-unit.source: The [**Battery**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895004) object triggers the [**ReportUpdated**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.battery.reportupdated) event when charge, capacity, or status of the battery changes.
trans-unit.target: The [**Battery**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895004) object triggers the [**ReportUpdated**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.battery.reportupdated) event when charge, capacity, or status of the battery changes.

trans-unit.source: This typically happens immediately for status changes and periodically for all other changes.
trans-unit.target: This typically happens immediately for status changes and periodically for all other changes.

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to register for battery report updates.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to register for battery report updates.

trans-unit.source: Handle report updates
trans-unit.target: Handle report updates

trans-unit.source: When a battery update occurs, the [**ReportUpdated**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.battery.reportupdated) event passes the corresponding [**Battery**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895004) object to the event handler method.
trans-unit.target: When a battery update occurs, the [**ReportUpdated**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.power.battery.reportupdated) event passes the corresponding [**Battery**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895004) object to the event handler method.

trans-unit.source: However, this event handler is not called from the UI thread.
trans-unit.target: However, this event handler is not called from the UI thread.

trans-unit.source: You'll need to use the [**Dispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR208211) object to invoke any UI changes, as shown in this example.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to use the [**Dispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR208211) object to invoke any UI changes, as shown in this example.

trans-unit.source: Example: basic battery app
trans-unit.target: Example: basic battery app

trans-unit.source: Test out these APIs by building the following basic battery app in Microsoft Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Test out these APIs by building the following basic battery app in Microsoft Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: From the Visual Studio start page, click **New Project**, and then under the **Visual C# > Windows > Universal** templates, create a new app using the **Blank App** template.
trans-unit.target: From the Visual Studio start page, click **New Project**, and then under the **Visual C# > Windows > Universal** templates, create a new app using the **Blank App** template.

trans-unit.source: Next, open the file **MainPage.xaml** and copy the following XML into this file (replacing its original contents).
trans-unit.target: Next, open the file **MainPage.xaml** and copy the following XML into this file (replacing its original contents).

trans-unit.source: If your app isn't named **App1**, you'll need to replace the first part of the class name in the previous snippet with the namespace of your app.
trans-unit.target: If your app isn't named **App1**, you'll need to replace the first part of the class name in the previous snippet with the namespace of your app.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you created a project named **BasicBatteryApp**, you'd replace `x:Class="App1.MainPage"` with `x:Class="BasicBatteryApp.MainPage"`.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you created a project named **BasicBatteryApp**, you'd replace `x:Class="App1.MainPage"` with `x:Class="BasicBatteryApp.MainPage"`.

trans-unit.source: You should also replace `xmlns:local="using:App1"` with `xmlns:local="using:BasicBatteryApp"`.
trans-unit.target: You should also replace `xmlns:local="using:App1"` with `xmlns:local="using:BasicBatteryApp"`.

trans-unit.source: Next, open your project's **MainPage.xaml.cs** file and replace the existing code with the following.
trans-unit.target: Next, open your project's **MainPage.xaml.cs** file and replace the existing code with the following.

trans-unit.source: If your app isn't named **App1**, you'll need to rename the namespace in the previous example with the name you gave your project.
trans-unit.target: If your app isn't named **App1**, you'll need to rename the namespace in the previous example with the name you gave your project.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you created a project named **BasicBatteryApp**, you'd replace namespace `App1` with namespace `BasicBatteryApp`.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you created a project named **BasicBatteryApp**, you'd replace namespace `App1` with namespace `BasicBatteryApp`.

trans-unit.source: Finally, to run this basic battery app: on the **Debug** menu, click **Start Debugging** to test the solution.
trans-unit.target: Finally, to run this basic battery app: on the **Debug** menu, click **Start Debugging** to test the solution.

trans-unit.source: **Tip** To receive numeric values from the [**BatteryReport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895005) object, debug your app on the **Local Machine** or an external **Device** (such as a Windows Phone).
trans-unit.target: **Tip** To receive numeric values from the [**BatteryReport**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn895005) object, debug your app on the **Local Machine** or an external **Device** (such as a Windows Phone).

trans-unit.source: When debugging on a device emulator, the **BatteryReport** object returns **null** to the capacity and rate properties.
trans-unit.target: When debugging on a device emulator, the **BatteryReport** object returns **null** to the capacity and rate properties.
